This is the trashtrap where the River Brent meets Welsh Harp Reservoir, a Site of Special Scientific Interest. Met a guy from @EnvAgency clearing it but it‚Äôs 1 wheelbarrow at a time so slow-going. They won‚Äôt touch beyond the trap bcus it‚Äôs not their remit. But sadly‚Ä¶
Thread 1/4 https://t.co/1864MeLcP9

Despite legal obligations to co-manage Brent Reservoir #SSSI (Welsh Harp) a councillor admitted to me today in a meeting with local pressure groups that Barnet Council have no ecologist, no parks enforcement & no biodiversity plan. Yes, you read that right. https://t.co/jdwCr2WlMJ

tweets.text: Following recent heavy rain and snow melt, water levels are high on the upper River Coquet in the Caistron Lakes area.  More information is available here https://t.co/4A5hmGlqJl https://t.co/TVQGnFP7XP

We are taking measures to minimise the risk of flooding to communities around Rothbury and will be closing the flood gates. For advice and support on how to protect your home in the event of a flood, contact Floodline‚ÄØfor advice and support on 0345 988 1188‚ÄØ#floodaware

We've closed the Rothbury flood gates due to rising water levels on the River Coquet. There may be a small amount of leakage observed as the gates are in operation so we have also put up temporary flood barriers to offer additional protection to homes and businesses #floodaware https://t.co/WojeiTonQV
@EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @NewsNBC this tweet pretty much sums it up... when will Red Industries mismanagement of Walleys Quarry be addressed?  @StinkStopthe https://t.co/ZpBpaZ7xcS

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@BarnetCouncil @Thames21 @welshharpies @silkstreamers @Feargal_Sharkey @NaturalEngland @TonyJuniper They are working on a 'vision for Welsh Harp' to be published later this year at a cost of ¬£20k that will replace the last 'vision for Welsh Harp' published only five years ago.
